action.action-desc: Mrs. Miller of Illinois (for herself, Ms. Tenney, Ms. Hageman, Mrs. Biggs of South Carolina, Mr. Tiffany, Mr. Burchett, Mr. Owens, Mr. McCormick, Mr. Self, Mr. Onder, and Ms. Boebert) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Workforce

form.official-title: To provide that for purposes of determining compliance with title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, locker room facilities in active use in connection with an education program or activity may be in use only by individuals of the same sex as determined solely on each individualâ€™s reproductive biology and genetics at birth.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Keep Our Girls Safe Act of 2025.

It shall be unlawful under title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972 (20 U.S.C. 1681 et seq.) for an individual of one sex (as determined solely on reproductive biology and genetics at birth) to use a locker room while such room is in active use by individuals of a different sex in connection with an education program or activity.
This Act shall take effect 30 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.
